intro: Gerascanthus monoicus, commonly known as the single-flower gerascanthus, is a rare and unique member of the Geraniaceae family. It is characterized by its solitary, showy flower that blooms in late spring or early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is native to a limited geographic region in southern Africa. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and the stem is often hairy and upright. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native environment.
